title: Energy levels of atom as photon is absorbed

content.question: The figure above shows energy levels for a mercury atom. A photon with energy 2.03 eV is incident on a mercury atom that is in its first excited state. The atom absorbs the photon and subsequently makes a transition to its ground state. Which of the following correctly describes the process the atom goes through?

choices.label: It starts at -10.38 eV , transitions to -3.71 eV , and ends at -5.74 eV .
It starts at -5.74 eV , transitions to -3.71 eV , and ends at -5.74 eV .
It starts at -5.74 eV , transitions to -3.71 eV , and ends at -10.38 eV .
It starts at -10.38 eV , transitions to -8.35 eV , and returns to -10.38 eV .

content.answer: It starts at -5.74 eV , transitions to -3.71 eV , and ends at -10.38 eV .
